item.title: Please update your Itunes link
item.description:
Please update your Itunes link, you have to delete your old Fireball XL5 podcast subscription and then search for Fireball XL5 again (or see the Itunes link at www.fireballxl5.ca ) and re-subscribe.
Sorry for the making you do all this, but I haven't been able to figure out another way to do it.

Remember the Fireball XL5 Homepage is at www.fireballxl5.ca

item.title: Fireball XL5 - March 30, 2012 (Love Resistor)
item.description:
A song from 1987 that I have never heard of was my top song of the week, thanks to the Popcasting podcast ( http://popcastingpop.com/ ) for letting me know about it.

The second set was interesting as it mostly stemmed from a few of the openers that I have seen lately and really enjoyed, bands names Bleached and Hospitality. Although I wasn't paying a great deal of attention to them when I saw them, I now wish I had as I have enjoyed listening to since seeing them. Just goes to show you that you should always try and at least listen to the opening acts to see if you should get the venue early. This is similar to what happened last year as I enjoyed the albums by both the Craft Spells and Veronica Falls more than the bands they opened for.

Fireball XL5 Setlist - March 30, 2012
TALK - Theme
Apple Boutique - Love Resistance
Bandana Splits - Sometimes
Nervous Curve - Touch Wood
Pepper Rabbit - Rose Mary Stretch
The Mary Onettes - Ready
TALK
Bleached - Searching Through The Past
Tennis - Origins
Hospitality - Eighth Avenue
Heartless Bastards - The Mountain
Youth Lagoon - Afternoon
TALK
La Sera - Never Come Around
Lawrence And The Comfortable Society - Heartache
King Creosote And Jon Hopkins - Honest Words
Cat's Eyes - The Best Person I Know
Gayngs - The Gaudy Side Of Town
TALK (random ending)
Sunny Intervals - Sunset on Parliament Hill


Remember the Fireball XL5 Homepage is at www.fireballxl5.ca

item.title: Fireball XL5 - March 2, 2012 (Thinking of you)
item.description:
Finally a show of relatively new music after all of the best of shows. I have been waiting a while to play the Dimitri From Paris remix of Sister Sledge which just gives me a great feeling whenever I listen to it. That led to funky opening set which I followed by a couple of sets featuring songs that have been on my MP3 player for a while.

Fireball XL5 Setlist - March 2, 2012
TALK - Theme
Sister Sledge - Thinking Of You (Dimitri From Paris Remix)
Mayer Hawthorne - Your Easy Lovin' Ain't Pleasin' Nothin'
The Intruders - Love Is A Baseball Game
Charles Bradley - The World (Is Going Up In Flames)
The Sparkles - Hipsville 29 BC
TALK
The Henry Clay People - Two Lives At The End Of The Night
Jeremy Jay - Caught In A Whirl
Yellow Ostrich - Hate Me Soon
The Give It Ups - Let's Be Frank
Bleached - Searching Through The Past
TALK
Baby Dayliner - When I Look Into Your Eyes
Kurt Vile - Jesus Fever
Big Troubles - Bite Yr Tongue
Mike Snow - Billie Holiday
Amanda Mair - Doubt
TALK (random ending)
Yo La Tengo - Take Care


Remember the Fireball XL5 Homepage is at www.fireballxl5.ca

item.title: Fireball XL5 - January 27, 2012 (Best albums of 2011)
item.description:
This podcast features selections from my favourite albums from last year, it was a very good year for me musically with whittling the list down to the final 10 proving to be a difficult task. Let's hope for the same next year.

Fireball XL5 Setlist - January 27, 2012
TALK - Theme
Veronica Falls - Stephen (Veronica Falls)
Kidstreet - Penny Candy (Fuh Yeah) (C)
Lykke Li - Youth Knows No Pain (Wounded Rhymes)
TALK
Knock Knock Ginger - Safety in Letters (We're Heading For A Fall) (C)
The Pains of Being Pure at Heart - My Terrible Friend (Belong)
Yuck - The Wall (Yuck)
Yuck - Stutter (Yuck)
TALK
Sakert! - Can I (pa engelska)
Sakert! - Honey (pa engelska)
TALK
Craft Spells - You Should Close The Door (Idle Labor)
Craft Spells - Scandinavian Crush (Idle Labor)
TALK
The Acid House Kings - Are We Lovers Or Are We Friends? (Acid House Kings)
The Acid House Kings - Under Water (Acid House Kings)
TALK
Those Dancing Days - Dream About Me (Music Sounds Better With You)
Those Dancing Days - Fuckarius (Music Sounds Better With You)

(C) - Denotes Canadian Content


Remember the Fireball XL5 Homepage is at www.fireballxl5.ca

item.title: Fireball XL5 - January 6, 2012 (Best singles of 2011)
item.description:
The best singles I heard that were released in 2011, note not the best singles I heard in 2011 as sometimes I'm a bit behind the times and I try to keep the list limited to actual 2011 releases. Next show will be the best albums of 2011.

Fireball XL5 Setlist - January 6, 2012
TALK - Theme
Sloppy Joe - Sometimes
Generationals - Ten-Twenty-Ten
Those Dancing Days - I'll Be Yours
Craft Spells - After The Moment
Lykke Li - Get Some
TALK
Razika - Why Have We To Wait
Acid House Kings - Would You Say Stop?
Knock, Knock, Ginger - It's Your Money Honey (C)
Wild Flag - Romance
Yuck - Georgia
TALK
Those Darlins - Be Your Bro
TV Girl - Baby You Were There
Neon Indian - Hex Girlfriend
Amanda Mair - House
Toro Y Mori - Still Sound



Remember the Fireball XL5 Homepage is at www.fireballxl5.ca
